key_facts: Nuclear power is gaining renewed interest after years of decline.
Climate goals and energy security concerns are driving nuclear interest.
Tech companies like Microsoft, Google, and Amazon are demanding nuclear power.
The US, UK, France, and South Korea plan to expand nuclear programs.
31 countries aim to triple nuclear power by 2050.
Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) are being promoted as scalable nuclear options.
SMRs are not yet commercially proven.
Public opinion on nuclear power remains divided.
Past nuclear accidents affect public trust in nuclear energy.
Long-term radioactive waste disposal remains unresolved.
Supporters say nuclear is essential for carbon reduction goals.
Critics highlight nuclear’s high costs and cleaner energy alternatives.
The future of nuclear may depend on resolving waste issues.
The viability of SMRs could shape nuclear energy’s future.
